org.bladerunnerjs.api

Interface BrowsableNode

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.bladerunnerjs.model.AssetContainer, BRJSNode, BundlableNode, org.bladerunnerjs.model.engine.Node
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    org.bladerunnerjs.model.AbstractBrowsableNode, Aspect, BladesetWorkbench, BladeWorkbench, Workbench

    public interface BrowsableNode
extends BundlableNode
    A BrowsableNode is a location that contains an index page, which would be a Aspect, BladeWorkbench or BladesetWorkbench.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void filterIndexPage(java.lang.String indexPage, Locale locale, java.lang.String version, java.io.Writer writer, org.bladerunnerjs.model.RequestMode requestMode)
      The method replaces the tag handlers from your index pages with the appropriate content as indicated, such as the required CSS bundle, for example.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.bladerunnerjs.api.BundlableNode

        assets, getBundleSet, getLinkedAsset, handleLogicalRequest, handleLogicalRequest, seedAssets

      • Methods inherited from interface org.bladerunnerjs.model.engine.Node

    • Method Detail

      • filterIndexPage

        void filterIndexPage(java.lang.String indexPage,
                     Locale locale,
                     java.lang.String version,
                     java.io.Writer writer,
                     org.bladerunnerjs.model.RequestMode requestMode)
              throws ModelOperationException
        The method replaces the tag handlers from your index pages with the appropriate content as indicated, such as the required CSS bundle, for example.
        Parameters:
        indexPage - a String object representing the content of the index page
        locale - a Locale object representing the locale used
        version - a String object representing the version used
        writer - a Writer object used as a stream for the newly updated content
        requestMode - a RequestMode object showing whether the request is made in DEV (development) or PROD (production) mode
        Throws:
        ModelOperationException - if any exceptions are thrown when performing the filter
